intro: Polygala hohenackeriana var. rhodopea, commonly known as the Rhodope Polygala, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
